required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Life, Treatment Experience and Cost of Treatment With Somatostatin Analogues in Patients With Gastroenteropancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumours
clinical_study.official_title: STREET- SOMATOSTATIN TREATMENT EXPERIENCE TRIAL An Observational Cross Sectional International Trial Investigating Quality of Life, Treatment Experience and Direct Cost of Treatment With Somatostatin Analogues in Patients With Gastroenteropancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumours (GEP-NETS)

brief_summary.textblock: Data from this study will contribute additional knowledge regarding patient outcomes and direct somatostatin analogue (SSA) treatment related costs in clinical practice in the Nordic countries. Such knowledge can be of importance in a treatment decision, decision support for development of care, follow up and training of both patients and primary care nurses.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with injection problems according to the subject
primary_outcome.description: Subject questionnaire asks "In your opinion, how did the last injection go?", subject chooses either 'no problems' or 'problems occurred'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life, mean physical health score in SF-12 derived according to the SF-12 manual.
secondary_outcome.description: Mean physical health score and mean mental health score in SF-12 derived according to the SF-12 manual

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life, mean mental health score in SF-12 derived according to the SF-12 manual.
Subject experience: proportion of subjects reporting "much" or "very much" anxiety in subject questionnaire.
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects asked "To what extent do you feel anxiety before the injection?"

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean number of packs of H01CB03 and H01CB02 purchased.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective data collection of a 1 year period

secondary_outcome.measure: Median number of packs of H01CB03 and H01CB02 purchased.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective data collection of a 1 year period

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean number of two consecutive dispensed prescriptions of H01CB03, H01CB02 within seven days during the pre-specified one-year period of retrospective data extraction.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective data collection of a 1 year period

secondary_outcome.measure: Median number of two consecutive dispensed prescriptions of H01CB03, H01CB02 within seven days during the pre-specified one-year period of retrospective data extraction.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective data collection of a 1 year period

secondary_outcome.measure: Median frequency of visits to treating physician in hospital will be derived as number of (frequency) of revisits recorded in the subject questionnaire.
Median time - visits to primary care for injections; visits to treating physician at hospital; time to travel
Median time for giving injections of SSA in subjects, derived as the time reported in the nurse questionnaire.
Proportion of nurses who reported "moderately" or "very" or "very much" confidence in giving injections

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Diagnosed with a Gastroenteropancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumour (GEP-NET) and treated with SSA for at least three months but not more than 3 years
- GEP-NET proliferation index Ki 67 <10%
- Over 18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- No specific exclusion criteria defined
